body: ### Description I originally filed this issue against `rust-tools.nvim`, but realized it affected all language servers: https://github.com/simrat39/rust-tools.nvim/issues/205. The gist is that I'm running Windows within my Mac using Parallels and mounting a directory from my Mac onto the Windows machine. The path is `\\Mac\Home\projects\distant` for my Rust project, which isn't a traditional path like `C:\path\to\distant`. I'm making the assumption that the path is what is causing the issue, otherwise there's some problem with the mounted directory. comment_data.body: Now that I know what the error is, this might be more relevant to file against neovim itself? I'm not sure what the fix is, unless there's something neovim or nvim-lspconfig is doing to garble the path before sending it to the LSP server.

> this might be more relevant to file against neovim itself?

I think so.

I'm guessing that the mounted path is actually a network path on Windows. `\\Mac\Home` is a specific directory mounted into my VM using Windows networking. So my guess is that any network path is going to fail with neovim. I tested both `rls` and `rust-analyzer` on VS Code using my network path and they work, so it is possible to have a language server work with a network path! ðŸ˜„

`nvim version 0.9.2`
I've encountered the same issue on windows 10, but I want to add something to the context:
- opening a file directly, will attach the client (e.g. `nvim main.go`)
- opening a folder in neovim then `explicitly` opening the file will attach the client (e.g. `nvim . -> :e main.go`)
- opening a folder in neovim then opening a file with something like `nvim-tree`, won't attach the client correctly

I'll try to reproduce this behaviour on another windows machineðŸ˜ƒ

Edit:
Can confirm that the problem is the full `UNC` path;
Using relative paths or using the [mapped drive name](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/map-a-network-drive-in-windows-29ce55d1-34e3-a7e2-4801-131475f9557d) instead of the `UNC` equivalent(`\\ServerName\folder` -> `K:\`), will result in everything working correctly.
If anyone is wondering, `nvim-tree` resolves the filepath as `UNC`, this i why it's not working ðŸ˜…

title: LSP: Network paths in Windows (`\\Mac\Home\projects\distant`) cause invalid string values with LSP servers
